devdoc.author: Fabian Vogelsteller <fabian@lukso.network>, Jean Cavallera (CJ42), Yamen Merhi (YamenMerhi)
devdoc.details: Bundles ERC725X and ERC725Y, and ERC1271 and allows receiving native tokens.

params._data: the call data, or the contract data to deploy
params._operation: the operation to execute: CALL = 0; CREATE = 1; CREATE2 = 2; STATICCALL = 3; DELEGATECALL = 4;
params._to: the smart contract or address to interact with. `_to` will be unused if a contract is created (operation 1 and 2)
params._value: the value of ETH to transfer

params._keys: the keys which values to retrieve

returns.values: The array of data stored at multiple keys

params._hash: hash of the data signed//Arbitrary length data signed on the behalf of address(this)

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._keys: the keys which values to retrieve
params._values: the array of bytes to set.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: Abstract (Core) implementation of ERC725Account

execute(uint256,address,uint256,bytes).notice: Executes any other smart contract. Is only callable by the owner.

getData(bytes32[]).notice: Gets array of data at multiple given `key`

isValidSignature(bytes32,bytes).notice: Checks if an owner signed `_data`. ERC1271 interface.

setData(bytes32[],bytes[]).notice: Sets array of data at multiple given `key`
